==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=种}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|禾|重|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}.

===Etymology===
Perhaps Sino-Tibetan: {{cog|cdm||tuŋʔ-|to plant}}, {{m|cdm||duŋ|to shoot, to sprout}}, {{m|cdm||duŋ-|to sprout, to grow}}. Compare {{och-l|腫|to swell}} and {{och-l|踵|heel}}.

Related to {{cog|mkh-vie-pro|*k-coːŋʔ||seed}} ({{cog|vi|giống||seed}}), which is likely a loanword from Chinese ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1948}}).
